communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Field Interview Cards (Anaheim Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting copies of blank field interview cards or equivalent forms filled out during a police stop. Search 2018 to 2024, if there have been no changes since 2018 to the cards, then that year is sufficient. 

Thank you

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Library Contract Request: Westlaw at SUNY Binghamton

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Library Contract Request: Westlaw at SUNY Binghamton
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with Thomson Reuters relating to the licensing of the Westlaw Campus Research database; and
All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations with language governing the use of the Westlaw Campus Research database.
Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of the Westlaw Campus Research database.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

mo

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #FOIL-2023-019-00037
communications.communication:
Dear Records Access Officer:

This is an appeal of the OMB's determination on 9/12/24, regarding the above request. The OMB has constructively denied my request. The possible return date of 11/15/24 -- more than a year after the request was filed – is unreasonable, given the narrow scope of the request.

Because of this appeal, the OMB is required by law to provide specific reasons within 10 business days explaining why this request cannot be filled, or else, must provide the records sought.

According to the Committee on Open Government, if a government entity acknowledges that a request has been received, but has failed to grant access by the specific date given beyond twenty business days, or if the specific date given is unreasonable, a request may be considered to have been constructively denied (see §89[4][a]).  In such a circumstance, the denial may be appealed in accordance with §89(4)(a), which states in relevant part that:

“...any person denied access to a record may within thirty days appeal in writing such denial to the head, chief executive or governing body of the entity, or the person therefore designated by such head, chief executive, or governing body, who shall within ten business days of the receipt of such appeal fully explain in writing to the person requesting the record the reasons for further denial, or provide access to the record sought.” 

I, on behalf of New York Focus, am requesting either you fill this FOIL request, or else provide a full explanation as to the reason for the denial, as required by law, of this public record.

Sincerely,
Sam Mellins
Senior Reporter, New York Focus

communications.subject: [OpenRecords] Note Added to FOIL-2023-019-00037
communications.communication:
Attention Office of Management and Budget (MOMB) Users, The following note was added to FOIL-2023-019-00037 by the requester: (https://a860-openrecords.nyc.gov/request/view/FOIL-2023-019-00037)

Dear Records Access Officer:

This is an appeal of the OMB's determination on 9/12/24, regarding the above request. The OMB has constructively denied my request. The possible return date of 11/15/24 -- more than a year after the request was filed – is unreasonable, given the narrow scope of the request.

Because of this appeal, the OMB is required by law to provide specific reasons within 10 business days explaining why this request cannot be filled, or else, must provide the records sought.

According to the Committee on Open Government, if a government entity acknowledges that a request has been received, but has failed to grant access by the specific date given beyond twenty business days, or if the specific date given is unreasonable, a request may be considered to have been constructively denied (see §89[4][a]). In such a circumstance, the denial may be appealed in accordance with §89(4)(a), which states in relevant part that:

“...any person denied access to a record may within thirty days appeal in writing such denial to the head, chief executive or governing body of the entity, or the person therefore designated by such head, chief executive, or governing body, who shall within ten business days of the receipt of such appeal fully explain in writing to the person requesting the record the reasons for further denial, or provide access to the record sought.”

I, on behalf of New York Focus, am requesting either you fill this FOIL request, or else provide a full explanation as to the reason for the denial, as required by law, of this public record.

Sincerely,
Sam Mellins
Senior Reporter, New York Focus

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All email correspondence, with attachments, mentioning "Water Property Investors," "Water Property Investor II," or "Water Property Investor III." 

2. Pitch decks, prospectuses, or any other materials provided to NMERB by the the above funds for consideration of potential investments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Julia Rock

communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen

My mailing address is 4521 N Central Park Ave. 3W, Chicago IL 60625. My phone number is 781-962-8816. Please feel free to give me a call if it's helpful to discuss any portion of this request. 

Thank you!

communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

Sincerely,
Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

title: Count of 5471 Forms Filed in tax years 2017-2024

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Count of 5471 Forms Filed in tax years 2017-2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking a count of Form 5471s that were filed to / processed by the IRS in tax years 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, and 2024 (noting that the filing season has not yet completed for 2024).  

If it is possible to distinguish between forms filed from a non-US address and forms filed from a US state, that would additionally be helpful. Similarly, if it can be identified what number of forms are attached to a personal 1040 return each year, that would additionally be responsive. 

I checked OMB control numbers 1545-0074 and 1545-0123, but these relate to the omnibus individual & business tax return filings, rather than this specific form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Lee

Good Day!

Please see attached response your FOIA request.

Thank you!

Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud. -Maya Angelu
Fate Merriam
Tax Law Specialist
DO 13
(206)946-3528 (Phone)
(855)205-9335 (E-Fax)
Internal Revenue Service
M/S W625
915 2nd Avenue
Seattle, WA 98174

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: overdose data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any draft or preliminary data, internal reports, or summaries regarding non-fatal and fatal overdoses among Boston residents for calendar years 2023, 2024, and 2025 (to date), collected under the CDC Overdose Data to Action (OD2A) grant or from other sources. 
Any data files, internal communications, or documentation used for reporting or submitting this information to the CDC during the same period.
Any draft or pending updates to the Boston Overdose Dashboard, including materials related to updates in Microsoft Power BI, whether or not those updates have been published publicly.

As the current OD2A grant cycle runs from September 1, 2023, through August 31, 2028, and includes funding for enhanced surveillance and timely dissemination of data, responsive records for this period are expected to exist even if not yet finalized for publication.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: overdose data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Massachusetts Public Records Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on March 25, 2025. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: overdose data
communications.communication:
**Appeal Regarding Public Records Request #183914 (Overdose Data)**

To the Supervisor of Records:

I appeal the Boston Public Health Commission’s failure to respond to my March 25, 2025 request for records concerning overdose data from 2023 to present. As of today, April 16, 2025, no response has been issued.

This violates G.L. c. 66, § 10(b), which requires a response within 10 business days.

Further, public remarks made by Dr. Bisola Ojikutu, Executive Director of the BPHC, at the April 15, 2025 meeting of the South End-Newmarket-Roxbury Working Group confirm that the requested overdose data exists and is being actively reviewed, cited and discussed by BPHC leadership.

The agency is in default, and I respectfully request that your office compel a response without further delay.

Sincerely,  
Brian McCarter

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: overdose data
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon Mr. McCarter,

Thank you for your email. In order to proceed with an appeal, please provide a copy of your original March 25th public records request with all header information indicating to whom the request was sent. See 950 C.M.R. 32.08(1).

Best,
Michael Manning

Office of the Secretary of the Commonwealth
Public Records Division
One Ashburton Place, Room 1719
Boston, MA  02108
617-727-2832
Michael.Manning@sec.state.ma.us<mailto:Michael.Manning@sec.state.ma.us>

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (General Services Administration)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (General Services Administration)
communications.communication:
Dear General Services Administration,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to General Services Administration's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: General Services Administration FOIA Request Acknowledgement
communications.communication:
Dear SaiSai, 
The U.S. General Services Administration (GSA) has received your FOIA request and assigned request number 2025-FOI-00135 . You will receive a more detailed acknowledgment letter from GSA. Please use this number in all future correspondence regarding this request. 
If you have not done so already, please egister with GSA’s Public Access Link (PAL) to create an online profile with the email address used to submit this request. This will allow you to receive correspondence, view documents, check the status of your request, and make payments . Helpful instructions on how to register using Login.gov can be found here . 
If you have any additional questions concerning GSA FOIA requests, please email GSA.FOIA@gsa.gov
Regards, 
FOIA Requester Service Center 
U.S. General Services Administration

title: CA CVR Data Request (2022, 2024) (Orange County, California Registrar Of Voters)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CA CVR Data Request (2022, 2024) (Orange County, California Registrar Of Voters)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, for each of these elections, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast generated by the relevant voting system technology in Orange County in that year. Alameda County has an example of these records posted for the 2024 General Election on their Election Information for November 2024 under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report”. 

Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

Dear Ileana Garnand: 
The Idaho Department of Correction (IDOC) received your request for public records on 5/6/2025 and has assigned reference number R027560-050625 for tracking purposes. Your request will be processed in compliance with the Idaho Public Records Act, Idaho Code Title 74, Chapter 1. You may access the Idaho Public Records Act by clicking here. Please note, the Idaho Public Records Act does not require a governmental entity to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You have requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Idaho Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All department policy and guidance documents regarding transgender inmates, including but not limited to gender-affirming medical care, housing and treatment by staff. I also request records of any proposed and/or enacted changes to said policies made on or after Nov. 6, 2024 until date of search, if such documents exist.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-correction-3974%252Fidaho-doc-transgender-policies-186218%252F%253Femail%253Didahoidoc%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AAAUqo9BqlXM4VV0HIPEAlF1BNw%3A1uCUdF%3ARYMZf-rMzgQZ_jU-HuKPX_XmCG0XyC-QHaWFPOq5gg0 
IDOC is committed to transparency and is currently working to respond to your request within three (3) business days. Pursuant to Idaho Code § 74-103, IDOC may take up to ten (10) business days to locate the requested records. If the request cannot be provided within the allocated time, you will receive written notice. 
As outlined in Idaho Code § 74-102(10)(b), if processing your request for records requires more than two hours of labor or the number of pages being requested exceeds one hundred pages (100), you will receive a cost letter outlining the fees that must be paid before your request can be processed. Please note that your request will not be processed until IDOC receives payment. If your request takes less time to fulfill than estimated, you will be refunded the difference between the estimated and actual cost. Should your request take longer to process than expected or exceed the estimated pages, you will receive an additional cost letter. If IDOC does not receive payment within 21 days of the cost letter being sent, your request will be deemed withdrawn. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below. You will receive an email when your request has been completed. 
Thank you, 
Idaho Department of Correction To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the IDOC Information Center

title: TACOMA SCHOOL DISTRICT – Internet Access Devices - Wi-Fi "Hotspots" or District provided Internet Access Devices and related Internet Access Device Usage Information (2022-2025)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: TACOMA SCHOOL DISTRICT – Internet Access Devices - Wi-Fi "Hotspots" or District provided Internet Access Devices and related Internet Access Device Usage Information (2022-2025)
communications.communication:
TACOMA SCHOOL DISTRICT – Internet Access Devices - Wi-Fi "Hotspots" or District provided Internet Access Devices and related Internet Access Device Usage Information (2022-2025)

January 12, 2025

via email to publicrecords@tacoma.k12.wa.us

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) available regarding any and all internet routers, internet access points, wireless access points, Internet Router, "Hotspots," "Mobile Hotspots," "Cellular Hotspots," and any other physical hardware internet access devices provided by your agency (or donated on behalf of your agency) to employees, contractors, students, or the general public in the years 2022-2025.

Responsive public records include but are not limited to: invoices, receipts, and costs of the access devices themselves. Also all device serial numbers, device service providers, device IP addresses, device MAC addresses, device telephone numbers, device email addresses, and any other device specific identifying and device specific location information.

Also include any usage logs for the devices, device audit logs, as well as any reports of any theft of or misuse of the access devices including complaints or allegations of online/internet misconduct, hacking, or harassment/bullying of any kind in association with the use of any of these internet access devices provided by your agency the years 2022-2025.

Provide copies of all records documenting the person responsible for the usage of each device.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

Constructive Notice: Any and all communication(s) received on behalf of your agency in reference to this Public Records Request (RCW 42.45) from any unauthorized for-profit 3rd party company doing business outside the State of Washington will be the subject of a new public records request to your agency as to the origin and purpose of the communication as well as the identity of the sender of the communication.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act. Please provide a single fee request for all responsive records.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed contemporaneous exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

This letter acknowledges and responds to your public records request received by the Tacoma School District on January 13, 2025. It is my understanding that you are seeking the following records:


  1.  Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) available regarding any and all internet routers, internet access points, wireless access points, Internet Router, "Hotspots," "Mobile Hotspots," "Cellular Hotspots," and any other physical hardware internet access devices provided by your agency (or donated on behalf of your agency) to employees, contractors, students, or the general public in the years 2022-2025.


Responsive public records include but are not limited to: invoices, receipts, and costs of the access devices themselves. Also all device serial numbers, device service providers, device IP addresses, device MAC addresses, device telephone numbers, device email addresses, and any other device specific identifying and device specific location information.

Also include any usage logs for the devices, device audit logs, as well as any reports of any theft of or misuse of the access devices including complaints or allegations of online/internet misconduct, hacking, or harassment/bullying of any kind in association with the use of any of these internet access devices provided by your agency the years 2022-2025.

Provide copies of all records documenting the person responsible for the usage of each device.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION
If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

We are currently gathering records and at this time I estimate that it will take approximately 1 month to prepare the first installment of records located that are responsive to your request.  This estimate is based on the number of previously pending public records requests that our office is responding to, the time needed to locate and assemble the records requested, the need to determine whether any of the records are exempt from public disclosure, provide third party notice, as well as other work for which I am responsible. This request may be produced in installments. I will contact you on or about February 21, 2025 regarding the status of your request.

Sincerely,

Joey Christine Grant

This letter acknowledges and responds to your public records request received by the Tacoma School District on January 13, 2025. It is my understanding that you are seeking the following records:


  1.  Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) available regarding any and all internet routers, internet access points, wireless access points, Internet Router, "Hotspots," "Mobile Hotspots," "Cellular Hotspots," and any other physical hardware internet access devices provided by your agency (or donated on behalf of your agency) to employees, contractors, students, or the general public in the years 2022-2025.

Responsive public records include but are not limited to: invoices, receipts, and costs of the access devices themselves. Also all device serial numbers, device service providers, device IP addresses, device MAC addresses, device telephone numbers, device email addresses, and any other device specific identifying and device specific location information.

Also include any usage logs for the devices, device audit logs, as well as any reports of any theft of or misuse of the access devices including complaints or allegations of online/internet misconduct, hacking, or harassment/bullying of any kind in association with the use of any of these internet access devices provided by your agency the years 2022-2025.

Provide copies of all records documenting the person responsible for the usage of each device.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION
If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

Please find the first installment of records by accessing the following link: https://app.box.com/s/nk76nerr289j8o61u73agee634hni9fm  This link will be deactivated in 30 days.  If you have not accessed this link and downloaded the records by April 7, 2025, I will assume you no longer require these records and will close the request. If you have any issues accessing these records please let me know.

We are currently gathering records and at this time I estimate that it will take approximately 1 month to prepare the next installment of records located that are responsive to your request.  This estimate is based on the number of previously pending public records requests that our office is responding to, the time needed to locate and assemble the records requested, the need to determine whether any of the records are exempt from public disclosure, provide third party notice, as well as other work for which I am responsible. This request may be produced in installments. I will contact you on or about April 7, 2025 regarding the status of your request.

Sincerely,
[cid:image002.png@01DB8F62.B8388380]
Joey Christine Grant
Public Records Manager
Email: jgrant@tacoma.k12.wa.us<mailto:jgrant@tacoma.k12.wa.us>

communications.communication:
[TPS main color logo.png]

May 16, 2025

Via Email Only: 179657-62044372@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:179657-62044372@requests.muckrock.com>

RE: Public Records Request of April 22, 2025, Reference # P000137-042225

Re:         Response to Public Records Request P00016-011325


This letter acknowledges and responds to your public records request received by the Tacoma School District on January 13, 2025. It is my understanding that you are seeking the following records:


  1.  Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) available regarding any and all internet routers, internet access points, wireless access points, Internet Router, "Hotspots," "Mobile Hotspots," "Cellular Hotspots," and any other physical hardware internet access devices provided by your agency (or donated on behalf of your agency) to employees, contractors, students, or the general public in the years 2022-2025.

Responsive public records include but are not limited to: invoices, receipts, and costs of the access devices themselves. Also all device serial numbers, device service providers, device IP addresses, device MAC addresses, device telephone numbers, device email addresses, and any other device specific identifying and device specific location information.

Also include any usage logs for the devices, device audit logs, as well as any reports of any theft of or misuse of the access devices including complaints or allegations of online/internet misconduct, hacking, or harassment/bullying of any kind in association with the use of any of these internet access devices provided by your agency the years 2022-2025.

Provide copies of all records documenting the person responsible for the usage of each device.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION
If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

Tacoma Public Schools has reviewed its files and has determined that all responsive records have been produced.

Based on the District's understanding of your request, I believe we have now completed our search and provided you with all records that we have been able to locate that are responsive. Please promptly let me know if you believe we have misunderstood your request in any way or if you believe that we have not adequately responded to your request, and I will be happy to assist you further. Per RCW 42.56.550(6) Actions under this section must be filed within one year of the agency's claim of exemption or the last production of a record on a partial or installment basis.
This request for records in now considered closed.
For questions or additional information, please reply to this email.
Sincerely,

Joey Christine Grant

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Evansville ICE Raid
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act (Indiana Code § 5-14-3), I respectfully request access to and copies of public records related to communications and coordination between the Vanderburgh County Sheriff’s Office and U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). This request is made in the public interest and not for commercial use.

Specifically, I am requesting:

All communications (including emails, text messages, memos, meeting notes, or other correspondence) between any representative of the Vanderburgh County Sheriff’s Office and any representative of ICE from March 15, 2024 through May 1, 2024, regarding:

The planned immigration enforcement operation in Evansville in April 2024;

Any discussions about detaining individuals for "immigration misdemeanors" or "felony warrants";

Coordination, assistance, or participation in any such operations.

Please include all attachments to emails and other digital correspondence. Relevant keywords may include but are not limited to: “ICE,” “immigration raid,” “Evansville,” “felony warrant,” “immigration misdemeanor,” or “immigration operation.”

Any intelligence bulletins, memos, reports, presentations, or briefings regarding ICE activity in Vanderburgh County created, received, or distributed by the Sheriff's Office from January 1, 2025 to the present.

Any internal guidance, policies, or standard operating procedures (SOPs) used by the Sheriff’s Office regarding cooperation with federal immigration enforcement authorities (including ICE) currently in effect or in effect at any time since January 1, 2024.

Any incident reports, call logs, or field reports created by Sheriff's Office personnel in connection with ICE operations or suspected immigration enforcement activity in 2024 or 2025.

Any complaints, inquiries, or public concerns submitted to the Sheriff's Office by residents, community groups, or elected officials regarding ICE activity or immigration enforcement between January 1, 2024 and the present.

Any records of meetings (calendars, agendas, minutes, or briefing documents) between representatives of the Sheriff's Office and ICE officials from January 1, 2024 to the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Video and Audio and electronic files Wisconsin (Office of the Attorney General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am looking for the following records : 

(To clarify I am not looking for any records that are contained in the discovery files or discs that are already available.) 

I am looking for records pertaining to and for criminal case 2014CF000860 and the folllowing individuals : 
Kristopher Paul Torgerson 10/27/1979

Stephanie Ann Low 09/29/1988

The time scale for this is from September 2010 to March 2017. 

I am looking for the following any electronic files such as emails involving the two names. Any video files involving the two names. Any audio files involving the two names.  Any digital files. Any scanned letters or mail. 

If the request is too burdensome or broad please send me a list of the files you have so I can choose the relevant files from that list. 

I would ask that they be sent via email or email link. Or if not please let me know if the cost goes above $50 to send via shipping.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Emma

communications.subject: RE: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Video and Audio and electronic files Wisconsin (Office of the Attorney General)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Thank you for contacting DOJ regarding the status of your public records request. Your message was forwarded to our office. Our apologies for taking time to respond.

To the extent possible, DOJ works to process public records requests in the order in which they are received. Your request encompasses a large file and requires substantial time to process. DOJ must balance this work with its other responsibilities, which include processing records related to investigations into officer involved critical incidents and a high volume of other public records requests.

Please rest assured that DOJ is working to process your request. DOJ is committed to providing a thorough and timely response to your request. We appreciate your continued patience.

Thank you,

[cid:image001.png@01DB89CD.B21F2C50]
State of Wisconsin Department of Justice
Office of Open Government
17 W. Main Street
Madison, WI 53703
opengov@widoj.gov<mailto:opengov@widoj.gov>
Phone: (608) 267-2220

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Agency Roster (City of Fort Lauderdale Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

title: Communications re: LA wildfires between Mayor Karen Bass and Gov. Gavin Newsom

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Communications re: LA wildfires between Mayor Karen Bass and Gov. Gavin Newsom
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications (text messages, notes, calendar invites, letters, emails, inter-office memoranda, meeting minutes and agendas, etc.) between Mayor Karen Bass' office and the office of Gov. Gavin Newsom concerning the preparation for and response to the recent Hurst, Eaton, and Palisades wildfires in Los Angeles. Specifically, I request all copies of any notes, communications, and/or discussions between Mayor Bass's office and any agency within Gov. Newsom's office including, but not limited to the following: the Office of Emergency Services, the Environmental Protection Agency, Natural Resources Agency. 

Please include any and all communications that include the terms "Hurst," "wildfire," "fire," "warning," "red flag," "Palisades," "LA," "Eaton," "LAFD," "OES," and/or "Cal Fire."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lia Russell

Thank you for responding and following up with your determination. 

Is it possible for your agency to release materials as they become available, rather than wait until June 26 to release them all at once? 

Thank you, 
Lia Russell

communications.subject: Re: California Public Records Act Request: Communications re: LA wildfires between Mayor Karen Bass and Gov. Gavin Newsom
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Russell,

Thank you for your inquiry. The June 26, 2025 date we gave you is an
estimate for when we could produce the requested records to you, but if we
are able to provide the records sooner we will be pleased to do so.
Additionally, please note that pursuant to Government Code section
7928.000, the California Public Records Act with limited exceptions “does
not require the disclosure of correspondence of and to the Governor or
employees of the Governor’s office[.]” Therefore, this Office will only
produce non-exempt records.

Sincerely,

/s/

Robert Rodier Potter

Office of Mayor Karen Bass

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Communications re: LA wildfires between Mayor Karen Bass and Gov. Gavin Newsom
communications.communication:
Hi Mr. Rodier Potter: 

Thank you. I look forward to hearing from you before or around June 26. 

Best,
Lia Russell

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: AAM-300 Transparency
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- List of names, job titles, internal specialty of employees and contractors working within the FAA Aerospace Medical Certification Division (AAM-300)
- List of names of individuals with authority delegated to them by the Manager of AAM-300, David O’Brien
- Any internal studies verifying the efficacy of the CogScreen-AE
- Total number of deferred medical certificates for FY23 (1st, 2nd, 3rd classes)
- Total number of Special Issuances issued for FY23
- Total number of outstanding deferrals within AAM-300 as of the date this FOIA request is processed
- Copies of Memorandums of Understanding (MOUs) between the FAA, Veterans Affairs, and the Social Security Administration for information-sharing of disability benefits
- List of names, job titles, internal specialty of employees and contractors working within the FAA Special Projects division
- Establishing documents of the FAA Special Projects division

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dwight Pina

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #FAA-2024-02743
communications.communication:
I am appealing the denial of requested information by the FAA. It appears that the (b)(6) redactions have been made in bad faith, citing concerns for "harassment." Letter from Susan Northrup to FOIA Requester (Jan 2025).

The FOIA's Exemption 6 can only be applied when there would be a "clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy." 5 USC 552(b)(6). The FAA has failed to meet the bar to demonstrate that harassment of AAM-300 employees may occur from the disclosure of  names. Indeed, courts have recognized that "[g]overnment employees, and specifically law enforcement personnel, have a significant privacy interest in their identities, as the release of their identities may subject them to embarrassment and harassment." Halpern v. FBI, 181 F.3d 279, 296-97 (2d Cir. 1999). But, the employees of AAM-300 are not "law enforcement personnel" nor have a "significant privacy interest in their identities" Id. “An agency must at least explain the ground for concluding that there is some factual basis for concerns about harassment, intimidation, or physical harm.” United America Financial, Inc. v. Potter, 667 F. Supp. 2d 49, 55 (D.D.C. 2009). The FAA has failed to explain any ground for its "concerns about harassment" Id. The Supreme Court has agreed that "[n]ames and other identifying information do not always present a significant threat to an individual's privacy interest." Wood v. F.B.I, 432 F.3d 78, 88 (2d Cir. 2005) (see Department of State v. Ray, 502 U.S. 164 (1991)).

OPM has recognized that release of information about certain employees in specific job categories may "constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy." See The U.S. Office of Personnel Management Data Release Policy August 2020, (Sept. 1, 2020), https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/data-analysis-documentation/data-policy-guidance/data-standards/data-release-policy-august-2020.pdf; 5 USC 552(b)(6). The job codes identified by OPM include officers of the Internal Revenue Service and law enforcement personnel. Absent from OPM's guidance are the job categories that FAA has redacted, such as legal instruments examiners. DOT and similar agencies have already released information for those in the same job category, demonstrating there is no cognizable privacy interest for employees of AAM-300. See, e.g., FedsDataCenter, https://www.fedsdatacenter.com/federal-pay-rates/index.php?y=all&n=&l=&a=&o=LEGAL+INSTRUMENTS+EXAMINING. The information sought is already in the public domain, and FAA employees have "have no privacy interest in information that is already in the public domain." Citizens for Responsibility & Ethics in Wash. v. U.S. Dep't of Justice, 840 F. Supp. 2d 226 (D.D.C. 2012).

The FAA has failed to reasonably segregate non-exempt material. Specifically, in the case of names of legal instruments examiners who are exercising delegated approval to sign letters for AMCD Manager, the equities weigh in favor of disclosure, as they have a reduced privacy interest due to their exercising of AMCD Manager's authority.  See Sensor Sys. Support, Inc. v. Fed. Aviation Admin., 851 F. Supp. 2d 321, 332 (D.N.H. 2012).

The decision of the FAA to withhold the requested information should be reversed and remanded.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #FAA-2024-02743 / AFAA-2025-00043
communications.communication:
Dear Dwight Pena:



This is to advise you that your administrative appeal from the action of the Federal Aviation Administration’s (FAA’s) Aviation Safety Office of Aerospace Medicine for Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request FAA-2024-02743 was received by this Office on January 16, 2025.  Your appeal has been assigned tracking number AFAA-2025-00043. Please mention this number in any future correspondence to this Office regarding this matter.



The FAA’s Assistant Administrator for Finance and Management (AFN-1) has the responsibility of adjudicating all FAA Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) appeals.  FOIA appeals are processed by the FAA Disclosure Branch (AFN-420).  Additionally, legal review is required for certain administrative appeal determinations.  See 49 C.F.R. § 7.22(d)(5).  In an attempt to afford each appellant equal and impartial treatment, the FAA has adopted a general practice of assigning and processing appeals in the approximate order of receipt.  We will notify you of the decision on your appeal as soon as we can.



If you have any questions about the status of your appeal, please feel free to reply to this email.



Sincerely,



Appeals Team

FAA FOIA Program Office

FOIA-Appeals@faa.gov<mailto:FOIA-Appeals@faa.gov>

202-267-3593

files.title: ~WRD0003
files.source: Federal Aviation Administration, United States of America

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #AFAA-2025-00043
communications.communication:
Hello,

I am providing notice of a supplemental authority in support of my appeal, Human Rights Defense Center v. United States Park Police, No. 23-5236 (D.C. Cir. 2025). In its opinion, the D.C. Circuit found that that the Park Police failed to "provide any concrete basis to conclude that release of [] officers’ names raises threats 'more palpable than mere possibilities'." Id. (quoting Dep’t of Air Force v. Rose, 425 U.S. at 380 n.19). Here, the FAA's (b)(6) redactions do no better than the Park Police, being "wholly conclusory, lacking even minimal substantiation" of AAM-300 employee's "privacy interest or the potential harm from disclosing their names." Id. The D.C. Circuit explained that "[g]eneralities are not enough; showing that a substantial invasion of privacy will occur if [] names are released requires reasonable specificity of detail rather than merely conclusory statements.” Id. (internal quotations omitted).

Sincerely,
Dwight Pina

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #AFAA-2025-00043
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

We are in receipt of your March 10, 2025, request for a status update.

This Office has adopted a first in/first out practice of processing all incoming appeals. Your appeal has been placed in chronological order based on the date of receipt and will be handled as quickly as possible.  Additionally, legal review is required for certain administrative appeal determinations.  See 49 C.F.R. § 7.22(d)(5).  This can increase processing times. Currently, your appeal is number 216 in our queue out of 236 open appeals.

At present, this office has requested the administrative file from the processing line of business and received some of the administrative file for review. Once all records are available for review, your appeal will go through the review process.

While we are unable to provide an exact estimated completion date, please know that we are actively processing your appeal.  If you have any questions regarding the status of your appeal, you may write to us at FOIA-Appeals@faa.gov<mailto:FOIA-Appeals@faa.gov>.  We do appreciate your continued patience.

Sincerely,

Sammie Jones

on behalf of the .
Appeals Team
FAA FOIA Program Office
FOIA-Appeals@faa.gov<mailto:FOIA-Appeals@faa.gov>

communications.subject: The Kansas Open Records Act Request: Kansas SEA response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Kansas Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the Kansas Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.communication: The records you have requested is attached.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records showing the standard issue of all uniforms to individual Cadets at The Citadel (e.g. Cotee, Blouse, white and or greay pants, class uniforms, etc.) for the past two academic years including the current academic year.
2. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the purchase of each uniform item for cadets (by item and total) over the past two academic years including the current academic year.
3. Records showing the current number of each uniform item issues to cadets and remaining in stock available for issue to Cadets over the past two academic years including the current academic year.
4. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the cost of cleaning of each type of uniform item for cadets over the past two academic years including the current academic year. Please exclude any costs for personal clothing.
5. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the cost of cleaning of maintenance of uniform item for cadets over the past two academic years including the current academic year. Please exclude any costs for personal clothing.
6. Records showing the number and type of different uniforms issued to the football and basketbal teams for the past two academic years including the current academic year and, if any of these uniforms were not re-used by subsequent players their disposition (discarded, given to players, etc.)
7. Records showing the source of funds used to purchase uniforms issued to the football and basketbal teams for the past two academic years including the current academic year.
8. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the purchase of each uniform items for the football and basketball teams (by item and total) over the past two academic years including the current academic year.
9. Records showing the current number of each uniform item issued to the football and basketball teams and remaining in stock available for issue over the past two academic years including the current academic year.
10. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the cost of cleaning of each type of uniform item for the football and basketball teams over the past two academic years including the current academic year. Please exclude any costs for personal clothing.
11. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the cost of cleaning of maintenance of uniform item for the football and basketball teams over the past two academic years including the current academic year. Please exclude any costs for personal clothing.
12. If Cadets receive their uniforms on a "rental" basis instead of purchasing them, please provide the records of any cost benefit analysis or study conducted that resulted in the rent vs purchase decision.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

communications.subject: FW: [External] RE: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: Citadel Uniform Costs
communications.communication:
Hello

I am the General Counsel at The Citadel. Your request has been forwarded to me for response. I apologize for the extended time it has taken to answer your email.

The South Carolina Freedom of Information Act requires public bodies to produce public records in their possession. S.C. Code Ann 30-4-30. Thus, I am attaching documents responsive to your requests in 1, 2, and parts of 3, and 5. I will send records responsive, in part, to Requests 6, 8 and 9  in a subsequent email.

FOIA does not require public bodies to create records.   The Citadel does not maintain "records showing the current number of each uniform item... remaining in stock." Request 3; see also Request 9 (football and basketball uniforms).

Cadets are ultimately responsible for cleaning their own uniforms. Requests 4 and 5.  They may do so through the standard laundry fee or through the on campus dry cleaning and laundry facilities, whose rates are available here<https://www.citadel.edu/auxiliary-services/dry-cleaning-and-laundry/>.  The Citadel includes a laundry fee of () as part of the overall tuition and fees it charges cadets.  The Citadel washes football and basketball uniforms in-house, therefore it does not maintain records of that cost. Requests 10 and 11.

The Citadel collects tuition and fees as described here<https://www.citadel.edu/sbs/tuition-fees/>.  It receives appropriations from the State of South Carolina as described here<https://www.scstatehouse.gov/budget.php>. Those funds are used to purchase uniforms issued to football and basketball teams.  Request 7.

As noted above, cadets purchase uniforms; they do not rent them. Request 12.

If you have any additional questions, please do not hesitate to contact me. Again, I apologize for the delay in providing this response.
Mark


Mark

[Citadel Logo Barracks Brandmark Navy]<https://citadel.edu/>
Mark C. Brandenburg
General Counsel
The Citadel

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records showing what specifically is included in the “Uniform fees” that are part of the Sudent activities fees charged cadets at The Citadel as well as the financial records showing ledger level itemized income and expenditures for Uniforms fees for the 2020 – 2021, 2021 – 2022, 2022 – 2023, 2023 – 2024 and 2024 – 2025 academic years including how this fee per cadet was determine, who approved the fee, all income to this fund by source, and all expenditures for these funds to the line-item level. For 2024 – 2025 include what is programmed, allocated and committed to date. These should include the portion of these fees allocated for uniforms and related Activities to include, without limitation, a definition of each “ Activity”. Itemized expenditures for uniforms and related Activities should total the amount reported as collected from Cadets and other identified sources. Itemized expenditures are requested for the amount allocated and line-item expenditures to each areas and what was budgeted for each for the selected academic years what will enable analysis of allocated to expended and within expenditures identify what products or services were procured. This information should be readily available in any reasonable standard accounting system using acceptable accounting practices and so should not require a significant level of efforts to identify and provide those records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

communications.communication:
Hello

I am the General Counsel at The Citadel. Your request has been forwarded to me for response. I apologize for the extended time it has taken to answer your email.

The South Carolina Freedom of Information Act requires public bodies to produce public records in their possession. S.C. Code Ann 30-4-30. It does not require public bodies to create records.  The Citadel does not maintain "financial records showing ledger level itemized income and expenditures for Uniforms fees" as you request below.  Creation of such records would require considerable time and expense.  Nonetheless, I am attaching a spreadsheet which describes the uniform items The Citadel requires all cadets to purchase. I am also attaching copies of purchase orders for those items. Pursuant to the College Regulations, available here<https://www.citadel.edu/bov/wp-content/uploads/sites/143/2025/04/College-Regulations.Published-version.pdf>, The Citadel's Board of Visitors has ultimate authority over uniform fees and other required charges to cadets.  A summary of all fees is available here<https://www.citadel.edu/sbs/tuition-fees/>.

If you have any additional questions, please do not hesitate to contact me. Again, I apologize for the delay in providing this response.
Mark

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Philly Mayor Fair Workweek comments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

All written communications received by the Mayor's Office from lobbyists or the general public during the period 1/1/2018–12/31/2018 concerning the Fair Workweek Law (File No. 180649). The requested records include written testimony, comments, letters, or emails addressed to former Mayor Kenney or his Deputies. 

I am requesting these records for non-commercial research purposes. The records will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer that the request be filled electronically, if possible, by e-mail attachment.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations
